meanings.definition: The pursuit of pleasure, especially in regards to food and drink.
meanings.sent1: Her epicurism led her to explore various cuisines and flavors.
meanings.sent2: Many people enjoy epicurism by trying different dishes and wines.
meanings.sent3: His epicurism was so strong that he couldn't resist trying the new dessert.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of stress, her epicurism was like a soothing balm.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the freshly baked bread awakened her epicurism.

meanings.definition: The belief that pleasure is the highest good in life.
meanings.sent1: Some people find happiness in epicurism, valuing pleasure above all.
meanings.sent2: Epicurism teaches that seeking joy is the ultimate goal in life.
meanings.sent3: His dedication to epicurism sometimes made others question his priorities.
meanings.sent4: To him, epicurism was not just a philosophy but a way of life.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of her epicurism brought a sense of contentment to her days.

meanings.definition: A devotion to the enjoyment of fine food and drink.
meanings.sent1: Their epicurism was evident in the exquisite meals they prepared.
meanings.sent2: Epicurism can be seen in the meticulous selection of ingredients and wines.
meanings.sent3: His epicurism extended to collecting rare wines from around the world.
meanings.sent4: The artistry of his epicurism transformed simple meals into culinary masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The joy of epicurism filled the room as friends gathered for a feast.
